qas.question: What in the use of Sanskrit has influenced Sino-Tibetan languages?
What religion was spread to China through Sanskrit translations?
What were transliterated and added to the Chinese language?
Where do many Sanskrit texts survive?
What languages have been influenced through the spread of Hindi texts?
What missionaries spread Islam to China?
Who sent Mahayana missionaries to India?
What Sanskrit texts survive in Egyptian collections?

context: <b5_0>Sanskrit<b5_0/> has also influenced <b6_0>Sino-Tibetan languages<b6_0/> through the spread of <a0_0>Buddhist texts<a0_0/> in translation. <a2_0>Buddhism<a2_0/> was spread to China by <b7_0>Mahayana missionaries<b7_0/> sent by <a1_0><b8_0>Ashoka<b8_0/><a1_0/>, mostly through translations of Buddhist Hybrid Sanskrit. <a3_0>Many terms<a3_0/> were transliterated directly and added to the Chinese vocabulary. Chinese words like 剎那 chànà (Devanagari: क्षण kṣaṇa 'instantaneous period') were borrowed from Sanskrit. Many Sanskrit texts survive only in <a4_0>Tibetan collections<a4_0/> of commentaries to the Buddhist teachings, <b9_0>the Tengyur<b9_0/>.
